html: My family came to the United States to continue my father's education and because my parents knew what was possible here, even if they never dreamed their son would serve in Congress. That is the promise of our country: hope and possibility. Our mission should be expanding both.

html: So much I wanna say about John Dingell, but I’ll leave it at this: He was a thoroughly good man. He went to Congress every day for 60 years to help people. He was kind, brilliant, fearless, opinionated, witty, and — my highest compliment of all — the definition of a House guy.
text:
So much I wanna say about John Dingell, but I’ll leave it at this:

He was a thoroughly good man. He went to Congress every day for 60 years to help people.

He was kind, brilliant, fearless, opinionated, witty, and — my highest compliment of all — the definition of a House guy.

html: To better understand Lincoln, the Civil War, Reconstruction, the history of race in America, and the nature of America itself, everyone should read more of Frederick Douglass. Black History Month is as good a time to start as any, but that's because it's always a good time. 6/6
text: To better understand Lincoln, the Civil War, Reconstruction, the history of race in America, and the nature of America itself, everyone should read more of Frederick Douglass. Black History Month is as good a time to start as any, but that's because it's always a good time. 6/6

html: In that 1876 speech, Douglass also wrestled at length with the complex balance of Lincoln's personal prejudices and the seeds of enlightenment along with the profound impact of Lincoln's public actions and their shortcomings. 5/6pic.twitter.com/xY1oQPRj1h
text: In that 1876 speech, Douglass also wrestled at length with the complex balance of Lincoln's personal prejudices and the seeds of enlightenment along with the profound impact of Lincoln's public actions and their shortcomings. 5/6pic.twitter.com/xY1oQPRj1h

html: Douglass said of Lincoln, "He was ready and willing at any time during the first years of his administration to deny, postpone, and sacrifice the rights of humanity in the colored people to promote the welfare of the white people of this country." 4/6pic.twitter.com/MYV7t129Y8
text: Douglass said of Lincoln, "He was ready and willing at any time during the first years of his administration to deny, postpone, and sacrifice the rights of humanity in the colored people to promote the welfare of the white people of this country." 4/6pic.twitter.com/MYV7t129Y8

text:
Moments ago I intro’d a bipartisan resolution with @CongressmanRaja that:

1. commends USDOJ’s work against Russia meddling.
2. agrees with Intel findings.
3. affirms Russia must be held accountable.
4. urges oversight re: Helsinki summit.
5. calls to implement sanctions.pic.twitter.com/A0wK3lK9Ny

html: I am still committed in fighting to reverse the @FCC’s repeal of #NetNeutrality. I have signed a petition to force a vote in the House and will continue to do whatever I can to #SaveTheInternet
text: I am still committed in fighting to reverse the @FCC’s repeal of #NetNeutrality. I have signed a petition to force a vote in the House and will continue to do whatever I can to #SaveTheInternet

html: Small businesses in my district rely on an open internet when it comes to starting their business. A repeal of #NetNeutrality will hurt them and is detrimental to the success of our country. #SaveTheInternet
text: Small businesses in my district rely on an open internet when it comes to starting their business.  A repeal of #NetNeutrality will hurt them and is detrimental to the success of our country.  #SaveTheInternet

html: #NetNeutrality ensures a level playing field online and makes sure everyone has access to a free and open internet
text: #NetNeutrality ensures a level playing field online and makes sure everyone has access to a free and open internet

html: A government that is by, of, and for the people is only possible when all eligible citizens have access to the voting booth. That is why I joined my colleagues on the Voting Rights Advancement Act and why I'm determined to minimize the effect of the Shelby County v. Holder case.
text: A government that is by, of, and for the people is only possible when all eligible citizens have access to the voting booth. That is why I joined my colleagues on the Voting Rights Advancement Act and why I'm determined to minimize the effect of the Shelby County v. Holder case.

html: 5 years after the Supreme Court decided the Shelby County v. Holder case, many states have enacted laws that threaten access to the ballot and the right to vote. It’s time to #RestoreTheVOTE
